formdata.value:
Establishment of Jinnah Hospital

(Polyclinic (PGMI)-II at G-11/3, Islamabad

The Federal Government Polyclinic PGMI-II (Jinnah Hospital) project aims to establish a modern, 400-bed
tertiary care hospital in Sector G-11/3, Islamabad. The initiative responds to the severe healthcare
infrastructure gap in Islamabad, where no major public hospital has been built since 1988 despite rapid
population growth, urbanization, and the increasing burden of communicable and non communicable
diseases.


The hospital will provide high-quality, accessible, and integrated medical services to residents of
Islamabad, surrounding districts, Gilgit-Baltistan, and Azad Jammu & Kashmir. It will also accommodate
the healthcare needs of underserved populations, including Afghan refugees and migrant communities. As
a state of-the art institution, it will enhance emergency services, outpatient and inpatient care, diagnostic
capacities, teaching facilities, and biomedical support systems.


The project is being executed by the Infrastructure Development Authority of Punjab (IDAP), with financial
allocation under the PSDP. The revised PC-1 reflects cost updates due to an increase in hospital capacity
from 311 to 400 beds, currency depreciation, rock-excavation challenges, addition of IT systems,
biomedical compliance requirements, and tax changes
